globalEvents.name: Open Crate 1
globalEvents.eventText:
You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

entityProperties.name: Crate1
entityProperties.theText: An old supply crate.

globalEvents.name: Mission Briefing
globalEvents.eventText:
Water beads on your brow as you trudge through the forest wetlands of Dathomir. You look and listen intently for any sign of the dangerous creature whose eggs you intend to steal. 

{-} Deploy the heroes to the blue highlighted space.

eventActions.theText: An alarm blares, shattering your concentration. An amplified Imperial voice screams, “Intruder alert; barricade the nest!” You see Imperial soldiers scrambling to erect improvised barricades.

entityProperties.name: Barricade Red 1
entityProperties.theText:
The barricade is a jumble of repurposed Imperial equipment and tree trunks taken from the jungle.

{-} Pairs of matching Imperial mission tokens each represent a barricade. Barricades are blocking terrain. A Rebel figure can attack a barricade (Health: *1*, Defense: 1 {G}).

entityProperties.name: Barricade Red 2
entityProperties.theText:
The barricade is a jumble of repurposed Imperial equipment and tree trunks taken from the jungle.

{-} Pairs of matching Imperial mission tokens each represent a barricade. Barricades are blocking terrain. A Rebel figure can attack a barricade (Health: *1*, Defense: 1 {G}).

entityProperties.name: Barricade Blue 1
entityProperties.theText:
The barricade is a jumble of repurposed Imperial equipment and tree trunks taken from the jungle.

{-} Pairs of matching Imperial mission tokens each represent a barricade. Barricades are blocking terrain. A Rebel figure can attack a barricade (Health: *1*, Defense: 1 {G}).

entityProperties.name: Barricade Blue 2
entityProperties.theText:
The barricade is a jumble of repurposed Imperial equipment and tree trunks taken from the jungle.

{-} Pairs of matching Imperial mission tokens each represent a barricade. Barricades are blocking terrain. A Rebel figure can attack a barricade (Health: *1*, Defense: 1 {G}).

eventActions.theText: {-} Pairs of matching Imperial mission tokens each represent a barricade. Barricades are blocking terrain. A Rebel figure can attack a barricade (Health: *1*, Defense: 1 {G}).

You draw your weapons and return fire, hoping that the noise will not attract any dangerous creatures.

{-} The mission will progress when a barricade is destroyed.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

{-} Pairs of matching Imperial mission tokens each represent a barricade. Barricades are blocking terrain. A Rebel figure can attack a barricade (Health: *1*, Defense: 1 {G}).
{-} The mission will progress when a barricade is destroyed.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

globalEvents.name: End of Mission - Rebels win
globalEvents.eventText:
Your shuttle roars to a stop above the trees and lowers a ladder. You climb on, continuing to fire into the remaining Imperials with caches of eggs in hand. Once aboard, you zoom over the red-tinged trees as the rancor roars and swipes at you from the ground.

{-} The Rebels win the mission!
{-} Each hero receives 1 XP. Heroes receive 200 credits per hero.

globalEvents.name: End of Mission - Rebels lose
globalEvents.eventText:
You retreat through the dense forest back to your shuttle, chased by the wild rancor. Behind her, the Imperial soldiers resume their egg collection, loading the precious commodities onto their own shuttles.

{-} The Rebels lose the mission.
{-} Each hero receives 1 XP. Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.
{-} Increase the threat level of the next mission (and only the next mission) by 1. During the Rebel Upgrade stage, the Rebel players can decide to spend 50 credits per hero to prevent this.

globalEvents.name: Claim Rancor Egg
globalEvents.eventText: You quickly, but carefully place the rancor egg in the cushioned cache.

globalEvents.name: Destroy Barricade Red
globalEvents.eventText: The barricade crumbles under your attacks.

globalEvents.name: Retrieve Egg 1
globalEvents.eventText:
You pick up the egg, balancing it in your arms.

Test {J}. If successful, you gain 2 movement points.

entityProperties.name: Egg 1
entityProperties.theText:
A rancor egg is safely nested in the underbrush.

{-} A Rebel figure can retrieve a rancor egg. When he does, that figure may test {J}. If he succeeds, he gains 2 movement points. A figure can carry only 1 rancor egg.

globalEvents.name: First Egg Retrieved
globalEvents.eventText: Rancor egg in hand, you signal your pilot that you're ready. "Gotcha", her voice crackles via comms. Seconds later, huge, cushioned crates drop near your location.

entityProperties.name: Cache 1
entityProperties.theText:
The cushioned crate is large enough to hold multiple rancor eggs.

{-} When a figure carrying a rancor egg enters a space adjacent to a cache, the heroes claim that rancor egg.

entityProperties.name: Cache 2
entityProperties.theText:
The cushioned crate is large enough to hold multiple rancor eggs.

{-} When a figure carrying a rancor egg enters a space adjacent to a cache, the heroes claim that rancor egg.

eventActions.theText:
{-} When a figure carrying a rancor egg enters a space adjacent to a cache, the heroes claim that rancor egg. Click the cache and select "Claim Egg".
{-} The Rebels win when he heroes have claimed 7 rancor eggs.
Block access to the eggs and the caches.
Take the rancor eggs to the caches (&Eggs Claimed&/7).

{-} Neutral mission tokens represent rancor eggs.
{-} A Rebel figure can retrieve a rancor egg. When he does, that figure may test {J}. If he succeeds, he gains 2 movement points. A figure can carry only 1 rancor egg.
{-} When a figure carrying a rancor egg suffers 3 or more {H}, that figure may test {K}. If they do not pass, they drop the rancor egg in their space.
{-} When a figure carrying a rancor egg enters a space adjacent to a cache, the heroes claim that rancor egg. Click the cache and select "Claim Egg".
{-} The Rebels win when he heroes have claimed 7 rancor eggs.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

globalEvents.name: Imperial Operation
globalEvents.eventText: You break through, interrupting the operation in progress. Imperial forces are busy collecting huge, scaly eggs that are strewn through the underbrush.

entityProperties.name: Egg 1
entityProperties.theText:
A rancor egg is safely nested in the underbrush.

{-} A Rebel figure can retrieve a rancor egg. When he does, that figure may test {J}. If he succeeds, he gains 2 movement points. A figure can carry only 1 rancor egg.

eventActions.theText:
{-} Neutral mission tokens represent rancor eggs.
{-} A Rebel figure can retrieve a rancor egg. When he does, that figure may test {J}. If he succeeds, he gains 2 movement points. A figure can carry only 1 rancor egg.
{-} When a figure carrying a rancor egg suffers 3 or more {H}, that figure may test {K}. If they do not pass, they drop the rancor egg in their space.
{-} The mission will progress when the Rebels retrieve the first egg.
The Imperial troops quickly turn their attention from collecting eggs to unleashing a fusillade of bolts directly at you.

{-} Neutral mission tokens represent rancor eggs.
{-} A Rebel figure can retrieve a rancor egg. When he does, that figure may test {J}. If he succeeds, he gains 2 movement points. A figure can carry only 1 rancor egg.
{-} When a figure carrying a rancor egg suffers 3 or more {H}, that figure may test {K}. If they do not pass, they drop the rancor egg in their space.
{-} The mission will progress when the Rebels retrieve the first egg.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

globalEvents.name: Mother's Domain
globalEvents.eventText: A mighty roar splits the air as a pair of massive arms tears through trees. The enormous gaping maw of a mother rancor bears down upon you. She will not easily give up her eggs.
